review_title: Good Place to work ,Terrible HR Departments
pros: Most of the senior leadership team is good. I thoroughly enjoyed my time here and would probably still be employed if salary compensation was adequate.
cons: The one downfall of this organization is the Human Resources department. It is pretty corrupt even with a new leader. It is the downfall of this organization. I've seen it with colleagues and great employees getting terminated for unjust reason but yet terrible managers and directors some how hang around like leaches. People talk and unfortunately this information is getting out. They continue to hire contractors to back fill positions of unjust terminations or for the people that left in general. They complain that the managed service budget is over goal. I'd hope that there is a study going on to why this us, I'm sure it will be blamed on burn-out. Worst HR departments I've ever seen in my career.

review_title: Carefully review your unit before you say yes.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Edgewood, KY
pros: I saw such bad management on my unit, it was the first time in my adult life where I planned my exit in the first month and stepped down gradually (every six months working less) because the management on my unit was so poor. I was routinely spoken to for doing my job, it wasn't equipped in very serious ways for a specific types life threatening of emergency. My fellow CNAs and I were constantly told we were out of our scope of practice when we absolutely were not. A great solid nurse manager makes all the difference when you're a Certified Nurse's Aide for St. Elizabeths Healthcare. CNA starting pay scale is on the low side, but if you really like the company they will pay for your education if you want to stay on as an employee. I liked my colleagues, but the middle management is ridiculous.
cons: See below for cons- thanks!

review_title: Not the worst, but certainly not the best
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Edgewood, KY
pros: Many of the people I worked with across many departments were absolutely awesome. I made a lot of very good friends working there. Excluding temporary restrictions implemented during the COVID-19 pandemic, it is easy to apply for new positions and transition to other departments.
cons: Management across all levels appears to be disorganized, inconsistent, and unfair. Often management and leadership are patronizing and talk down to those they oversee. Employees in a lower pay grade are treated differently and often more harshly by both management and other employees; it's not uncommon to hear other employees mocking them. Homophobia is a problem there, and based on my experience I don't expect them to do anything about it. I also witnessed racist, sexist, and homophobic conversations between coworkers but lack of good leadership left me feeling that it was pointless to report it. We were constantly understaffed but expected to perform as if we were. It really felt like all management truly cared about was our numbers and ratings, not the actual patients. Some nurses abused their power and delegated tasks to the CNA's just so they could relax. There were many occasions were nurses spent time just to find a particular aid to delegate a task to in the time it would have taken to just do the task themselves. CNA's on my floor were frequently given busy work if the Charge Nurse saw things were slow. More recently, during the COVID-19 pandemic, the most support we ever got was a pizza party and emails of well wishes from senior leadership which felt a bit disingenuous. It took them almost a year to give us any sort of pandemic-related bonus or pay increase, but that was only if you picked up more than your boarded hours. It feels like if your not a physician or a manager there, you're just another disposable employee. St. Elizabeth's stated values (Innovation, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, Excellence) seem to be hollow based on what I experienced working there.

review_title: No longer a "Best place to work"
pros: Big hospital with great potential
cons:
They are wasting their 150 years of success in a series of poor administrative decisions
Constantly run nursing units short staffed in order to save money
Use sub par supplies in surgery to save money You get what you pay for
Have succeeded in discouraging nearly the entire nursing work force to the point that they are looking to work elsewhere but St. E has a monopoly in NKY
Unhappy employees lead to unhappy patients and families
Everything is about money, patients and employees are only a drain on the bottom line to administration

review_title: All considered, a good place to work.
pros:
Definitely co-workers.  I was on the IS side so didn't deal with (THE EXTRAORDINARY) nurses much, except to assist them with IS issues.
Can't really complain "much" about the salary and bonuses.
Folks obviously love their jobs because they never f@(#!&% leave them.
I will have to say they gave me a solid "Second chance".
Healthcare, that business is only growing and growing.
cons:
Certain jobs could never really enjoy any of the fun perks like ice cream socials, or say departmental meetings.
Burnout.
They love putting people on 'levels' to make sure they are out of the bonus pool.
NO advancement unless someone left a specific position (which happened ONCE in five years working there).  To get out of certain areas you had to be a nurse or have other super specialized training.
You can watch productivity fall month after month and all you get is "Well, do better because you're not getting help"
Slackers are never ever made accountable. (PRO for you slackers)

review_title: I was disappointed and I expected a better job experience from a hospital.

pros: St. Elizabeth is the largest employer in Northern Kentucky and they do offer profit sharing. There are many different locations that one can work from and they continue to grow from a business perspective.
cons: In my experience, there are no advancement opportunities within the corporate side of the operation. If you are a nurse or someone that is clinical then you can move up the ranks but if you are in an admin role then you are pretty much stuck. They also prefer to hire from outside of the system as opposed to within the system when filling new positions as well.

review_title: Great organization with a great culture!
pros:
Senior leadership is approachable and listens actively listens to feedback from the associates within the organization.

Organization consistently gives tenure increases and offers a gainsharing incentive to all associates.

Great benefits including an employer contribution of 6% of your annual earnings.  This benefit is offered to anyone who works 20 hours or more.
cons: No major complaints.  St. Elizabeth like other healthcare organizations is always searching for new talent in the tight workforce.

pros: This is a position that is very flexible and easy going. Great co workers, great pay- no complaints in general about this position.
cons: The only real issue that I have had in this position is that it can be emotionally difficult due to working in the emergency department. There are deaths, overdoses and domestic abuse cases that come in which can affect us.

pros: I have worked at a St.Elizabeth for over 15 years. It is truly one of the best organizations I have ever worked for. St. Elizabeth gives back to the community and surrounding regions and really listens to its employees. The open door policy makes my manager approachable and I feel part of the family. The staff I  work with are like family.
cons: Compensation in certain areas could be more competitive but the benefits are good.

pros: High level of quality care.  Wants to become a high reliability organization. Supportive nursing structure with  experienced and proficient leaders.
cons: Systems not standardized.  Variation in process and training. Multiple priorities challenge the organization.

pros:
People you work with outside the marketing/communications department are nice.
Garren Colvin is doing a good job.
cons:
I worked in the corporate part of the system - in marketing and communications to be specific. There are a lot of cons.
- Lack of management support.
- Too heavy in middle management (almost a one-to-one manager-to-employee ratio) and lack of direction from the top.
- People in management that are not qualified managers, don't know how to properly manage employees or have not received management training.
- Senior management seems only concerned with appearance of the team, not the functionality or lack thereof of the team/department.
- An environment where they keep saying things will change and nothing ever does.
- Lack of structure and organization where people know who does what, causing constant overlap and double assignment.
- Somewhat threatening environment where you feel constantly at risk - where a few voices are listened to and are basically given carte blanche to treat the rest of the team abominably with no repercussions.
- Members of the department openly talk rudely about members of other departments that they dislike, do not agree with or come to them with additional work.
- Benefits are lacking, unless you are a KY resident. If you are an OH resident, you are basically second class in benefits where you have to travel, sometimes 30 minutes, just to have benefit-eligible care (such as urgent care).
- Takes 3 years to vest for retirement, so basically any money put away in retirement until then goes unmatched.
- Lack of diversity in the department and hospital system.
- Nepotism is strong (department heads in other departments being married or related in some way causing issue and/or lack of accountability).
Poor vacation policy - they say you get 21 vacation days when you start, but that is a falsehood because part of those vacation days are national holidays you have to take off, such as the 4th of July, Christmas, Memorial Day, Labor Day, etc. Once you subtract those, vacation is less generous.

pros: They support their mission and initiatives . Listen and respond to employees. Growth opportunities are available and encouraged.
cons: Lack of on board training will cause many hours of frustration, say placing an order or fixing a leaky faucet. You get to figure things out and hunt for a person who may know the answer.

pros: Status.   Part of a big hospital network.
cons: Poor health benefits,  training inadequate, expectations and shift to patient ratios not safe.

pros: Struggling to come up with pros. They have  a pension.   It's a pay check.  They are a monopoly in northern Kentucky
cons: High turn over. Hard to get hired. Tuition reimbursement limited. Working conditions are not desirable. Not enough effort to retain good and experienced RNs.

job_title: CNA Float Pool in Northern, KY
pros: Excellent Company to work for.
cons: Do not get in the float pool as a CNA, you show up to work at one site and then told you are needed somewhere else.  Drive to that location to find out they cancelled you and the first site did not notify you.

pros: Benefits. Good Management. Pleasant work environment.
cons: Pay is slightly lower than average. Little room for advancement in this specific position. This is a call center position and they do not tell you this in the interview.

pros: Very employee oriented. Always looking for ways to improve your work experience and to help their employees to grow in their job and education.
cons: We are very frequently understaffed. It is unsafe to the patients and causes undue stress to the staff. They have staffing schedules that are rarely met.

pros: The individuals who actually work on the floor are great and caring.
cons: Management is very profit oriented. For an organizat that is a not for profit that seems to be their main focus. They don't care about patients.

pros: They really care about their employees. They try to be transparent about everything they do as an organization. I feel empowered in my role.
cons: For whatever reason there seems to be some clicks among certain management. As an outsider coming in it's kind of hard to break through some of that. But other than that everybody is always nice

review_title: Mediocre healthcare: patients were wonderful; organization lacked heart.
pros: The patients and colleagues were wonderful. By and large, a very dedicated group of coworkers who strove for excellence and patient care. Decent benefits.
cons: The Human Resource department was a mess. Stringent and arbitrary rules and little care for those in the trenches. Profitability was the name of the game and little work/life balance.

review_title: I grew from a novice nurse to a critical thinking, experienced, confident member of the health care team.
job_title: Staff RN/Charge RN Labor & Delivery in Edgewood, KY
pros:
Large teaching hospital with residency program provided many opportunities for learning experiences and growth. 
Teamwork was essential with all jobs being important!
cons: As the hospital  grew over the years and became "big business", employees, as individual people, were less valued.

pros: This organization spares no expense to ensure patient safety and comfort. Constantly upgrading salaries to meet area standards. Active in the community.
cons: Staffing. Benefits... health insurance is awful, tuition reimbursement is worse! Sick leave and workman's comp pay is terrible as well.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: Great people. Patient Centered.  Teamwork. Excellence in what we try to do.  Strong commitment to the community in which we live
cons: Limited promotion potential due to physician group being separated from the hospital.  Leadership lacks openness and caring at times.  Poor communication of organizational changes.

pros: Family like atmosphere. Management is great to work with and employees treat each other like family. Salary is fair and equal
cons: Weekends are required. Benefits are a little expensive but there are several plans to choose from. Food choices are limited for employees at certain campuses

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Edgewood, KY
pros: Services are adequate, experienced and knowledgeable healthcare providers
cons: Negate honest employee feedback, chronic low staffing

review_title: Good Place to start a nursing career
pros: Growth and development oriented, Magnet status hospital, many opportunities for movement throughout the system
cons: As with most, raises and gain share hinge on overall hospital performance rather than personal performance

job_title: Unarmed Security Guard in Lafayette, IN
pros: Most people are friendly,the pay is good with benefits,Job is easy to do.
cons: They will spy on you making sure you are doing the work they hire you to do.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Thomas, KY
pros: Working in the transporter group is a team atmosphere.  The managers step in and assist whenever needed.
cons: Delivering carts to each floor in a timely manner can be tiring.  Nurses tend to use slang terms for instruments.

job_title: Epic Credified Trainer in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: Can work from home a few days a week . Environment is good as far as people being able to work together.
cons:
Communication is not always the best between departments. You have to train multiple applications to multiple offices.
Always very busy.

pros: Lots of job openings. Education opportunities through cohorts and tuition reimbursement.
cons: No longer about patient, staff, or physician satisfaction. Perceived monopoly in northern KY area makes staff satisfaction a very low priority. Overworked and underpaid. Patient/RN ratios very high.

job_title: Radiation Oncology Nurse in Edgewood, KY
pros: Positive and safe work environment. Teamwork is a bonus. Flexible, family oriented, with a high level of commitment to excellence. Positive values, and most importantly.. patients are number one in all we do.
cons: PTO with slow accrual despite work experience

review_title: Decent place to work if you have a good team.
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Fort Thomas, KY
pros: Good benefits. Good reputation in community.
cons: Big corporation, focus on the bottom line.

pros: Friendly staff. The department managers are good people to work for but are completely incapacitated by upper management.
cons: Constant focus on cost cutting. Job security threats are a constant source of concern. Staff is sent home constantly to cut costs.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Florence, KY
pros: I love working with the nurses and aides on my floor. They are always willing to help you if asked.
cons: Workplace politics, and some goals set by upper management that are hard to reach due to patient preception.

pros: Great place to work! great friends and teamwork! Most Physicians were great!
cons: There are some people that work there that likes to stir up trouble!

pros: Good benefits, flexible schedules, transfer opportunities, tuition reimbursement.
cons: As a nurse, magnet status has halted my career opportunities.

pros: It was close to my home
cons: Not a lot of room for growth, and management kind of let the department go away from the direction I wanted it to go.

pros: competitive wages, gain share program
cons: can be disorganized at time, some of the policies that exist as a resolute of it being a Catholic hospital conflict with my own values

pros: Good pay raises for the most part
cons: Strict time policy.  Need clock in at employee entrance.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Florence, KY
pros: Night shift bonus with signed contract, renew every 2 years. Gain share bonus for all staff, once a year.
cons: Needs more employee parking spaces.

pros: Great experience on med surg floor with lots of variety. Continuously learning.
cons: 12 hour shifts are long. Weekends and holidays do not seem worth it when comparing it to family time.

review_title: Company that cares about their employees
pros: Gainsharing, positive work environment, flexible hours
cons: Dealing with upper management, merger issues

pros: Good company overall and provide good care
cons: Managers micromanage everything!  Not treated professionally

pros: they care about the people who work there
cons: No consideration for experience over how long you have been there

pros: base pay comparable to other nursing jobs

unethical decisions

pros: Enjoyed my fellow employees learned a lot

review_title: St Elizabeth Hospital, Understaffed, but trying.
pros: Multiple campuses mean many opportunities for growth and change.
cons: Benefits are not always what they are promised to be.

review_title: Amazing company and place to work
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Edgewood, KY
pros:
Wonderful coworkers, very team-based approach to care. 
Excellent benefits
Opportunities for growth and mobility
cons: None, I loved working here.

pros: Good work environment, stable schedule
cons: Outdated unit, nurse staff difficult to work with

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Fort Thomas, KY
pros: Gain sharing. Tuition reimbursement. Full benefits.
cons: Managers don’t really take your feedback into consideration. There’s only two or three people they really listen to.

cons: Pay scale should be more toward national average.

pros: Culture and caring management.  Family like environment.
cons: Promotional opportunities for some in non nursing professions.

pros: Education re reimbursement, cohesive units/co workers

pros: Good coworkers, good hourly rate.
cons: Does not view staff as the backbone of the organization.

pros: 1st shift, parking, friendly peers outside dept,

pros: Reasonable pay, diverse opportunities, Magnet hospital
